newsitem.title: USA: Lockheed venture gets $93.9 mln contract.
newsitem.headline: Lockheed venture gets $93.9 mln contract.

text.p: Longbow LLC, a Lockheed Martin Corp and Northrop Grumman Corp joint venture, said it has recieved a $93.8 million U.S. Army contract for production of Longbow Apache fire control radar.

Deliveries, that consist of 10 mast mounted radars, one qualification radar and spares, will be completed in 1998 with work divided between Lockheed Martin's Orlando facility and Northrop Grumman's facility in Baltimore, Longbow said.

About 350 employees are assigned to development of the radar system and its weapons counterpart for the Apache attack helicopter, Longbow said. The radar system will enable the helicopters to set long-range targets for missiles regardless of conditions, the venture said.

The Longbow system will be integrated on the British WAH-64 Westland Apache and is scheduled for use on the RAH-66 Comanche advanced reconnaissance helicopter that is expected to enter service early in the 21st century, Longbow said.
